name: Skydive Swansea (GoSkydive)

images.note: Official images available at goskydive.com - check media gallery and Instagram @goskydive

description.short: Experience the thrill of tandem skydiving over the stunning Gower Peninsula and Bristol Channel at Wales' premier dropzone with GoSkydive.
description.full:
GoSkydive's Swansea dropzone offers the ultimate skydiving experience over one of Wales' most beautiful coastal landscapes. Located at Swansea Airport, just 6 miles from Swansea city centre, this is the newest addition to the GoSkydive family and brings world-class skydiving to South Wales.

With jumps available from both 10,000ft and 15,000ft, you'll experience between 30-60 seconds of breathtaking freefall at speeds of up to 125mph before your parachute opens and you glide peacefully back to earth. The views are spectacular - soar above the stunning Gower Peninsula coastline, the glittering Bristol Channel, and on clear days you can see across to Devon and Cornwall.

GoSkydive is one of the UK's leading tandem skydiving operators with tens of thousands of successful jumps. Every instructor is highly experienced and qualified, ensuring your safety while making sure you have the time of your life. The dropzone operates every weekend (Saturday and Sunday) from March through November, plus weekdays for larger groups and bank holiday Mondays.

Whether you're jumping for the first time, doing a charity skydive, or gifting an experience to someone special, Swansea offers convenient access from across Wales and the West of England. The site has café facilities on-site, ample parking, and a welcoming atmosphere perfect for nervous first-timers and excited thrill-seekers alike.

jumpHeights.totalExperience: Approx 5-7 minutes from exit to landing
Approx 7-9 minutes from exit to landing
jumpHeights.note: Upgrade available - arrange with dropzone after booking

jumpDetails.parachuteSystem: Tandem rig certified to British Skydiving standards

accreditations.name: British Skydiving
accreditations.description: Member club operating under British Skydiving regulations

features.cafeFacilities: Café and bar on site at Swansea Airport

requirements.minAgeNote: Under 18s require parental consent and BPA medical form witnessed by parent/guardian
requirements.maxAgeNote: Aged 40-69 require medical form 115A. Aged 70+ require pre-booking assessment and GP sign-off
requirements.weightNote: Surcharge applies: £10 for 15-16st, £20 for 16-17st, £30 for 17-18st. Weight must be proportionate to height.
healthRestrictions: Must complete BPA medical declaration form
Certain medical conditions require GP approval
No alcohol or drugs 24 hours before jump
requirements.whatToWear: Comfortable clothes you can move in, trainers or boots (no sandals), layers for cooler weather at altitude

operatingSchedule.days: Saturday and Sunday, plus Bank Holidays
operatingSchedule.note: All jumps are weather-dependent. Contact dropzone on day of jump if uncertain.

charityJump.note: Jump for free when you raise £395+ for a partnered charity

views.description: One of the UK's most scenic coastal skydives with panoramic views of the Gower Peninsula's golden beaches and dramatic coastline

whatMakesItSpecial: Only skydive location in South Wales at Swansea
Spectacular coastal views over Gower Peninsula
Part of GoSkydive - UK's leading tandem operator
Easy access from Cardiff, Swansea, and M4 corridor
15,000ft jumps available for maximum freefall time
Professional video packages to capture every moment
Experienced, friendly instructors with thousands of jumps
Café facilities and free parking on site

steps: Book online at goskydive.com or call 0333 005 0050
Choose your jump date (subject to availability)
Pay £50 deposit (balance due on the day)
Receive confirmation email with all details
Arrive at Swansea Airport on your jump day
Complete registration and safety briefing (30-45 mins)
Get kitted up and meet your instructor
Board the aircraft and enjoy the scenic flight up
JUMP! Experience the thrill of freefall
Parachute ride back to earth with stunning views
Land safely and celebrate your achievement!
bookingProcess.arrivalTime: Arrive at your booked time slot - allow 3-4 hours total
bookingProcess.cancellationPolicy: £50 deposit non-refundable. Free rescheduling up to 4 weeks before jump. £50 fee within 4 weeks, £100 fee within 7 days.

faqs.question: Is it safe?
faqs.answer: Yes! Tandem skydiving is very safe. GoSkydive has an excellent safety record with thousands of successful jumps. All equipment is regularly serviced and your instructor is highly experienced and qualified.

faqs.question: How long does it take?
faqs.answer: Allow 3-4 hours from arrival to finish. This includes registration, training, kitting up, the flight, the jump, and landing. The freefall itself is 30-60 seconds depending on altitude.

faqs.question: What if the weather is bad?
faqs.answer: Skydiving is weather-dependent. If conditions aren't suitable, you'll be contacted to reschedule. Always check with the dropzone on the day if you're unsure.

faqs.question: Can I bring spectators?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! Friends and family are welcome to watch. There's a viewing area and café facilities on site.

foundedNote: Newest addition to GoSkydive family (GoSkydive established 2005)
